intro: Odontocarya hernandia, commonly known as the Mexican toothbrush plant, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of yellow or brown. Odontocarya hernandia is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
